intro: Mikania chenopodiifolia, commonly known as the sand mat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. Its leaves are small, hairy, and have a distinctive shape resembling that of a goosefoot. Mikania chenopodiifolia is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it an important component of desert ecosystems.
